articles.title: Welcome to my site!
articles.contents:
About me
I am a postdoctoral researcher at FTZ. Working from home at a small town in Germany, which is not so far from the big city of Hamburg. My research interests include conservation, ecology, physiology and ecotoxicology. I work with coastal and marine animals mostly with shorebirds and seabirds. My goal is to know more about their lives in order to improve the conservation efforts.
I am currently working on analyzing spatial patterns of marine animals while collaborating with projects in Mexico and Chile. Also, I am a teaching R to technicians and students from my home town, Mazatlán. You can find the materials from my class (which are in Spanish) at this webpage.
I am very passionate about nature, R and QGIS.
If you are interested in some collaboration or have specific questions I am happy to help!
Just email me! 
I speak Spanish, English and a little bit of German.
